revised_title: Experimental Investigation of Gibbs' Thermodynamical Theory of Interfacial Concentration at an Air-Water Interface
tldr: The authors investigate Gibbs' thermodynamical theory of interfacial concentration in the case of an air-water interface, focusing on the adsorption of nonylic acid. They use a dropping pipette to measure surface tension and concentration, finding that the concentration at the interface is significantly higher than in the bulk solution, supporting Gibbs' theory.
